intro: Pseudoboivinella oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed boivinella, is a rare and unique species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile, where it thrives in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and potentially endangered species.
